Prescription.UsagePlan: Take 500mg-1000mg every 4-6 hours as needed for pain relief. Do not exceed 4g (4000mg) in a 24-hour period.
Prescription.Explanation: Acetaminophen is chosen for pain relief in the headache. It is effective in managing mild to moderate pain without affecting platelet function, which is crucial in cases of intra-parenchymal hemorrhage.

Prescription.UsagePlan: Administer as a continuous intravenous infusion at a initial rate of 25-50 mcg/hour. Titrate to achieve adequate pain control.
Prescription.Explanation: Fentanyl is a potent opioid used for severe pain management. In the case of acute pain from intra-parenchymal hemorrhage, intravenous fentanyl can provide effective analgesia with close monitoring for respiratory depression.
